title: the Schedule proposed to be carried out by or on behalf of the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Planning and Development Act 2000
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Planning and Development Act 2000 

(Section 181(2)(a)) (No. 2) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited planning development act 2000 (section 181(2)(a)) (no 2) order 2020

title: the Schedule proposed to be carried out by or on behalf of the
heading: 2. The Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) shall not
text_raw:
2. The Planning and Development Act 2000 (No. 30 of 2000) shall not 
apply, pursuant to subsections (2) to (2AA) of section 181 of that Act, to the 
development described in the Schedule proposed to be carried out by or on 
behalf of the Commissioners of Public Works in Ireland. 

1 OJ No. CI 384, 12.11.2019, p.1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th June, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [232] 3

title: the Schedule proposed to be carried out by or on behalf of the
heading: Live Animal Border Control Post at Interim Government
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Site: 

Live Animal Border Control Post at Interim Government 
Control Centre, Rosslare Harbour 

Address: 

FORMER ROSSLARE IMPORT CENTRE, N25, ROSSLARE 
HARBOUR, CO. WEXFORD, Y35 P797 

Description: The development is for a single storey live animal inspection 
building of approximately 335m2 to provide stabling and 
inspection facilities for live animals, staff welfare facilities; 
signage and all ancillary site works; all within the existing 
boundary of lands of the former Rosslare Import Centre, for the 
provision of facilities that are required by reason of the 
withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union in 
order to provide for the required infrastructure for customs, 
sanitary and phytosanitary and health checks and controls. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [232] 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 

25 June, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [232] 5 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
